title: Is stuff like LoLTracker bannable?
body:
There's an app on overwolf called loltracker, [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-3RYl9I2aew) is what it does, is this bannable?
Thanks.

replies.body:
Keep Riot's general stance on [**third-party programs**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/225266848) in mind when dealing with any programs we didn't release ourselves. I'd say there's a decent chance something like that might be flagged as script, but I can't say for sure myself since I'm not on that team.

> No software should interfere directly with the in-game player experience, from when you press “Play” to the end-of-game screen.
ahh I guess I won't use it just to be safe

Since it's a separate program that doesn't do anything automatically, and you have to manually start each timer, I'd say it's OK, but it's definitely very close to the limit. For instance, does it adapt the timer for ward to the current level of players? Does it adapt the CD of Summoners based on Masteries used? That could tip it over the edge.

Also keep in mind that Riot can basically change their mind at will and suddenly decide new rules, and you can't say anything about it, so even a program that is perfectly OK one day could not be the next day. Be careful and stay tuned, check news regularly, etc.
